page-home.title: Home
page-home.heading: Hi, I'm Nikia.
page-home.text: I'm a web developer based in Victoria, BC. I'm intent on building accessible, performant, and inclusive web experiences. I would like to acknowledge that I live and work on the traditional territory of the Lekwungen peoples, today known as the Esquimalt and Songhees Nations. Thank you for having me, T’oyaxsut nüüsm (thank you all).

project-1.title: Full-Stack Portfolio
project-1.technologies: React, Figma, Javascript, TailwindCSS, Git, Linux (Ubuntu), Apache, MariaDB, PHP, LetsEncrypt, Certbot, SSH, PuTTY
project-1.description: My portfolio is my successful attempt at creating a full-stack web application. The front-end is built with React and TailwindCSS, and the back-end is built with Linux (Ubuntu), Apache, MariaDB, PHP, LetsEncrypt, Certbot, SSH, and PuTTY. I also used Git for version control. I am very proud of this project because it is the first time I have built a full-stack web application. I learned a lot about the process of building a full-stack web application, specifically the back end management

project-2.title: Canadian Climate Conference
project-2.technologies: WordPress, Sass, Git, Adobe XD, Asana
project-2.description: This project is the culmination of what I learned while at BCIT. I worked with a team of 3 other students to create a website for a fictional climate conference. We used WordPress as the CMS, Sass for styling, Git for version control, Adobe XD for wireframing, and Asana for project management. I am very proud of this project because it represents months of study and the goals and aspirations for everyone on my team. This project was planned from start to finish, using a mock memo of understanding, wireframes, and development plan.

project-3.title: School Wordpress Site
project-3.description: This pretend school site was developed with one other person and is a WordPress site. We used Sass for styling, Git for version control, and PHP for the back-end. This project was intended to put our WordPress skills to the test.

project-4.title: BKPR - Next.js Movie App
project-4.technologies: Next.js, Sass, Git, Adobe XD, Adobe Photoshop
project-4.description: BKPR (Be Kind Please Rewind) is a database movie web application that uses Next.js. I was primarily responsible for the component logic, and had developed the initial web design. This site was inspired by the movie rental stores of the 80s and 90s. I am very proud of this project because it was the first time I had used Next.js, and I learned a lot about the framework. I also learned a lot about component logic and how to use it to create a dynamic REST API web application.

project-5.title: Yijing Oracle
project-5.description: The Yijing, also known as the I Ching, is an ancient Chinese Divination Tool. In our second month of the program, I had created the oracle with vanilla JavaScript, then rewriting it in TypeScript months later. I enjoyed writing this application the most, it tested not only my JavaScript skills, but also my deduction skills. Following my Python course at BCIT, this was my first attempt at writing a complex application in JavaScript and for a front-end environment. Since this application is based on a cultural practice, I did my best to ensure that it was not only culturally accurate, but so that the logic followed a traditional coin toss method.

project-6.title: Front-Page Recreation: Audioengine
project-6.description: This project was a recreation of the front page of Audioengine's website. I had developed this with two others, and we had just learned Sass and version control with Git. I was personally responsible for some styling and the slick carousels.
